title: Fully Convolutional Slice-to-Volume Reconstruction for Single-Stack MRI
author: Sean I. Young, Yael Balbastre, Bruce Fischl, Polina Golland, Juan Eugenio Iglesias
aff: Abstract  In magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), slice-to-volume reconstruction (SVR) refers to computational reconstruction of an unknown; D magnetic resonance volume from stacks of; D slices corrupted by motion. While promising, current SVR methods require multiple slice stacks for accurate; D reconstruction, leading to long scans and limiting their use in time-sensitive applications such as fetal fMRI. Here, we propose a SVR method that overcomes the shortcomings of previous work and produces state-of-the-art reconstructions in the presence of extreme inter-slice motion.
